supportDesc.condition: Palm-leaf. Relatively good state of preservation, in spite of many bore holes caused by insects.

origin.origDate: The date provided in a year of the Jovian cycle in the colophon (U3b, f273rv) cannot be ascertained since at least one of its calendrical elements is wrong. Possible (and plausible, since the MS was part of Ariel's bequest made to the Société Asiatique in 1855) conversions in the Gregorian are: 1656, 1716, 1776 and 1836. The appearance of the MS makes 1716 and 1776 the most plausible dates. For further details, see Ciotti & Franceschini (forthcoming). Cabaton (1912, p. 49) dates the manuscript to 1732. The reason for this date is unknown.

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).

body.p: The Upatēcakāṇṭam is the seventh Kāṇṭam of the Kantapurāṇam, written by Kōṉēriyappar (15th century?) as a supplement to the the Kantapurāṇam of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār. There is another version by Ñāṉavarōtayar (15th century?).
Other manuscript testimonies of this text are: GOML D. 538–539 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, pp. 517–518.); TMSSML cat. n° 451ff. (see Olaganatha Pillay 1925, pp. 361ff.).
The palm-leaf bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains, on the front woodcover:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: B/14.
It contains, between the two woodcovers:
U2: 1 folio, unfoliated = flyleaf. Used as notebook by later hands.
U3a: 1 folio, unfoliated = invocation page, by hand n° 2.
U3b: 273 folios, Tamil foliation 2–73 (f1 not explicitly foliated) and 104-273 = text (mūlam), by hand n° 2. 8 to 9 lines per page.
The text is complete. There is no text discontinuity between U3a, f73v and f104r, only a foliation discontinuity. The total stanzas is 4333 (U3b, f273r8).

Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, invocation page, marginal title, marginal chapter headers, in-text chapter completion statements, in-text intermediate total stanzas, text total stanzas, colophon, notes (calculations?).

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: marginal benediction, title.
(f[1]r, lm, 1–2) veṟṟivēl uṟṟa tuṇai
(f[1]r1–2) kantappurāṇattil Upatēcakāṇṭam
U2, folio 1, recto and verso, unfoliated = flyleaf: notes (calculations?) by later hands. Tamil numerals arranged in a table of the recto. Series of Tamil numerals on the verso.

U3a, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = invocation: marginal benedictions and title; 1 invocatory stanza.
(f[1]r, lm, 2) hari namosttu
(f[1]r, lm, 2) kaṇapati cakāyam
(f[1]r, lm, 3) Upatēcakaṇṭam
(f[1]r1) kuḻaviveṇpiṟai milaicciyōrk kuṇittamāta vatti ‡ ṉiḻaitaṭampuṉalaruvi tāḻim(ai)yamīṉṟaḷitta ‡ maḻaimatarttakaṇ mākatappacumpiṭipa(ya)nta ‡ taḻai (ma)ṭaṟcevit-
(f[1]r2) tantipoṟ caraṇamēcaraṇam {pcs} tirucciṟṟampalam {pcs} civacuppiramaṇiya {pcs}

U3b, folio 1, recto = incipit: marginal chapter header; stanza n° 1 of Mākayilaimāṉmiyam.
(f1r, lm) māka(yi)laimāṉmiyam
(1r1) tiṅka ḷañcaṭai yempiṟāṉ ṟiruvaruḷ perukap ‡ poṅku tiṅkaṇmum māriyum poḻika pūtalati [i.e. pūtalatti] ‡ leṅka ṇāyakaṉ ṟirukkuḻāt toṇṭarī ṭēṟat ‡ taṅku nāṉmaṟaic caivanū lōṅkaṟan
(1r2) taḻaikka {pcs} 1 {pcs} (…)

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
